intro: Niphobolus rotundifolius, commonly known as the round-leafed niphobolus, is a species of flowering plant in the family Malvaceae. It is native to parts of Africa, particularly South Africa, where it thrives in arid and semi-arid environments. The plant is characterized by its rounded, succulent leaves and produces small, yellowish flowers that bloom during the cooler months. It is often found in rocky or gravelly soils and is adapted to withstand periods of drought. The species is of interest to botanists due to its unique morphology and ecological adaptations.
